column4: hey guys... im trying to "./configure, make, make install" a program named p2kmoto... but look what happens in "make": http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/32487/ How do i fix it?
it is very likely that you are missing the kernel-headers....do  a sudo apt-get install build-essential
it says "build-essential is already the newest version" :(
hmmm.. that is weird.. one sec
yep that should do it.. sure looks like the headers are missing
newest version too :(
id try this is as sudo su .... find /  -name usb.h
lets see if it exists at all..
seems as if ndiswrapper has that...header..
so what i must do?
uname -a returns?

it seem that it "looks" for the presence of the file in a very specific location in the make file...and based on your paste...the usb.h file is in include...so maybe some sort of symbolic link to that?
id open up that make file and see where it is trying to look for usb.h
thats my two cents...
do you need to do the make all as sudo su or?? im just grasping for ideas now..
try it as root and see...
using sudo it gives me the same error :(
hang on...lemme do some checking around...
ok ;)
i made a test... i moved usb.h to the source directory and replaced include <usb.h> to include "usb.h" and it still not finding usb.h!!!
thats good advice...try...test...and see ...
